{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3148885,"name":"owen","username":"Lemonizer_2557","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/lemonizer_2557/{size}/179526_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-20T03:09:49.490Z","cooked":"

I was recently looking into the smallest FRC legal robots and that got me thinking What was the biggest? I instantly thought Rycycle rush because of the nearly limitless robot restrictions. But when I looked it up I couldn‚Äôt find anything. And when I checked Chief Delphi I also found nothing useful, so now I am asking ‚ÄúWhat was the Bigest FRC robot ever?‚Äù

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2023-02-20T03:09:49.490Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":349,"reads":705,"readers_count":704,"score":1886.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":427435,"topic_slug":"what-was-the-bigest-frc-robot-ever","display_username":"owen","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/whats-some-of-the-smallest-frame-perimeter-height-volume-and-largest-robots-ever-built/444643/2","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"What's some of the smallest (frame perimeter/height/volume) and largest robots ever built?","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":55336,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/what-was-the-bigest-frc-robot-ever/427435/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3148887,"name":"EricH","username":"EricH","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/erich/{size}/128938_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-20T03:16:24.690Z","cooked":"

The FlopBots.

These robots had a drivetrain that sat vertically in the starting configuration, then they fell down after match start. There are quite a few, many notable in their own right.

71, 2002: Probably the largest wingspan, and also could reach back to its home zone if I remember right.
67, 2005, and 340, 2005: These two had tall reach to go with their large drivebase, but didn‚Äôt have a lot of wingspan.
16, 2008: Not the largest‚Ä¶ but when you have a (comparatively) half-width field, it had a pretty decent percentage of field occupied.

Also, look before 2006, because there weren‚Äôt as many expansion restrictions then.

2015 is going to be a weird outlier because there were team like 148 that did field-spanning multibots. Other than that, I‚Äôd probably give it to one of the old school flop bots like 67 in 2005.

2007 giant ramp bots. I would rule out all tether machines

Old school flip bots are definitely the place to look.

The more modern era of FRC has had a few large robots outside of 2015 as well:

1710 in 2014 - about 80 inches wide, and 96 inches tall.

190 in 2008 (is 2008 the modern era still or am I old now?) - looks about 8 feet tall, and could flail out pretty far as it swung the giant game piece around the field.

More area down low. Bigger robots while still staying in the size limits.

Adding onto this - the OG 68 bot in 03 spanned the field.

But yeah, having been around a lot of these bots up close - 16 in 08 just feels massive. I think 2014 made us all forget how giant a horse soccer ball is.

The ramp barricade robots from 2003 were pretty impressive. (I am still not convinced that 68 deserved the late-breaking ruling that it was illegal to use when extending loosely over both sides of the middle rail.)

The Blue Alliance

Truck Town Thunder - Team 68 (2003)

FIRST Robotics Competition team from Ortonville, Michigan, USA.

The Blue Alliance

Children of the Swamp - Team 179 (2003)

FIRST Robotics Competition team from Riviera Beach, Florida, USA.
